text.tspan: 0. Construct Cartesian mesh on each processor covering all cells
1. Interpolate all particle volumes to the respective support grid points
using interpolation function (conservative, Lagrangian to Eulerian)
2. Compute solid volume fraction at each grid point assuming volume
3. Interpolate the Eulerian volume fraction to OpenFOAM cells
Need further investigations. Normalize by the ratio of
volume of Cartesian mesh/volume of OpenFoam.)
Similar procedure can be followed in calculating the
Interpolation of fluid phase velocity at particle locations:
No need for such an auxilary grid. Direct interpolation using the
Calculation of particle forces on fluid cells (conservation is essential)
The strategy is to compute force/volume on each grid point.
2. Map the forces to Cartesian grid points (conservative)
3. Compute force per unit volume on grid points. (conservative)
4. Map force per unit volume onto OpenFOAM cell centers. Renormalize.
